text.p: These are the leading stories in the Maltese press on Thursday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Prime minister meets delegations from the general Workers's Union. The left-leaning union, by far the biggest in Malta, presented a memorandum on what it feels political parties should include in their electoral programmes. Among other things, it is calling for a referendum on whether Malta should join the EU.
- Sea Nalta seamen on strike. The action was ordered by the GWU, which is pressing for better working conditions. The strike has prevented two container ships from leaving on Mediterranean trips.
